issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: During the start up, namenode waits for n replicas of each block to be reported by datanodes before exiting the safe mode. Currently n is tied to the min replicas config. We could set min replicas to more than one but we might want to exit safe mode as soon as each block has one replica reported. This can be worked out by introducing a new config variable for safe mode block count
fields.summary: introduce a new config specifically for safe mode block count

comments.body: Umm, doesn't this basically defeat the purpose of safe mode?

I think the minimum replication factor enforced for block allocations and replications can be separate from the factor used for calculating safe block count. We can make it use {{dfs.namenode.replication.min}} if the new config is not set.
Thanks [~aw] and [~kihwal] for providing opinions on this issue. I updated my patch according to kihwal's suggestion.

If we are going forward on it, this needs to have in the description that:

a) this is an expert level setting
b) that setting this lower than the min replication is not recommend and/or dangerous for production setups
[~aw] thanks for providing valuable review. Those descriptions are added to the latest patch.
Those need to go into the hdfs-default.xml.  (which this patch will likely fail in unit tests since there is a check for that now)
Thanks [~aw] for pointing out the problem. I have added the new config into hdfs-default.xml
